title: ostrze 1
paragraphs: to jest historia miłosna
papierowych dłoni
i metalowych nożyczek

title: the collective
paragraphs:
Do not mourn the atoms
that once called themselves my name;
they were just borrowed for a short while.
And at last they're coming back to the stars.

So, please,
there is no need to recall
for they no longer are mine.

title: old love
paragraphs:
There are times
when I almost forget
the oldest childhood friend
and the first shy love.

And then there are times
when all I can think of
are my oldest childhood friend
and my first shy love.

Oh how I wish I could stop them
from re-entering my mind.

But I just can't help it;
remnants of love are forever.

title: animal kingdom
paragraphs:
Why can a dog be just a dog,
why can a cat be just a cat,
why a bird can just be a bird,
while we have to be so much more than men?

Why can't a person be simply allowed
to only nap, walk, eat and laugh?

Why can all the others just be,
while we HAVE to do, to think, to achieve?

Is this the making of overgrown brains?
Is it all futile? Are we insane?

Or do other duties truly emerge
once a species learns its own name?

title: receipts
paragraphs:
on the fist receipt I found
i saw you bought a gym pass
(I never knew you went to the gym)

right in the next compartment
was a London metro ticket
(from the very last trip you took)

finally, there was another receipt
just two months younger
(but quite a bit longer)

marking the beginning of the end
with the list of all these meds
